positions.comment: Two days of moving on the boat.  Last shopping.  Off tomorrow!
We''re finally off.  Making sidetrip to Nanaimo for some business.  Then North.
Anchored at Jedediah Island.  Heavy weather sailing today.  Raining.
Campbell River.  Through Seymore Narrows early in the morning tomorrow
No problem through Seymore.  Tomorrow 4:30 am start for Greene rapids
Got up 4:30, listened to weather, looked outside and got back to bed.  Leave 9/7
Docked in Alert Bay Native Village.  Johnstone ; Strait was no problem today.
Anchorer in Booker Lagoon.  Saw whales.  Caught big Salmon for dinner!
Anchored in Claydon Bay.  Beautiful but pouring rain the whole day.
Blunden Harbour.  May stay tomorrow as well.  Need some sun!
Miles Inlet. Bit of sun today.  Weather permitting, Cape Caution in am.
Beautiful Hakai with real beach. Four killer whales 10m.  Breeching Humpback.
Another day at Hakai.  Still raining lightly.  Exercise on beautiful beach.
Docked at Shearwater.  Sunshine at last!
Oliver Cove. Just us and the glory of nature.
On our way again.
Butedale; a real ghost town, what with buildings falling into the sea and all.
Bishops Bay Hot Springs. Fantastic!
Difficult day with strong headwind.  Tomorrow Prince Rupert
PRINCE RUPERT!  Now a few days rest.
Alaska!  Ketchikan tomorrow.  Lots of Salmon today!
Ketchikan, Alaska.
Naha Bay.  Grizzly with cub and black bear fishing close to boat.  Incredible amount of salmon.
Anchored in Yes Bay, Behm Canal, Alaska
Bailey Bay.  2h hike to hot springs.  Beautiful lake, waterfalls, rainforest.
Bailey Bay.  2h hike to hot springs.  Beautiful lake, waterfalls, rainforest.
Misty Fjords National Monument.  Spectacularly beautiful.  No other humans.
Enough of rain!  Turning South again.
On our way again to Prince Rupert.  Foggy Bay. Nice sail today.
Back in Prince Rupert.
Porcher Island.  Beautiful sunshine. Sailing South now.
Taking the "outside-inside" route south.  rafted to three other boats.
Taking the "outside-inside" route south.  rafted to three other boats.
Kent Inlet.  Beautiful lagoon with salmon threatening to jump in dinghy.
Stayed put for the day.
Klemtu Native village.  Toured local "Big House" with beautiful Totems.
Back in Shearwater.  North to Ocean Falls tomorrow
Impending weather dictated coming to Codville lagoon and lake first.  BEACH!!
Beautiful long sand beach and freshwater lake.  Warm sun. Today pouring.
Ocean Falls ghost town
Namu.  To Hakai beach tomorrow.  weather improving.
Pruth Bay in Hakai park.  plan 4h "5 beaches" hike.
Bright sun, blue skies, white sand.  Plan to stay  another day
No alternator=no power=no radio=no-go.  Awaiting replacement fly-in
Still waiting for alternator to arrive
Replacement doesn't work.  Time for marine electrician in Port Hardy to look.
Repairs in Port Hardy.  All well.
Sointula.  Alternator fixed and mirror backup.  All well.
Joe's Cove in Broughtons.  Beautiful but still raining...aaargh!
Big Pig roast at Pierre's Bay Marina.  Interesting and friendly people.
Waddington Bay.  Rare sunshine day! The Broughton archipelago is beautiful!
Potts lagoon.  Now a string of sunshine days in a row.  What's up??
All you can eat prawns at Lagoon Cove!  Beautiful days. Northwest Gale tomorrow
More prawns.  Also caught our own prawns. Still waiting out gale
Forward Harbour.  Nice day. Found petroglyphs!!
Thurston Bay Marine Park last night.  Now Octopus Islands.
Heading to Princess Louisa Inlet and ; Chatterbox falls.
Heading to Princess Louisa Inlet and ; Chatterbox falls.  Egmont
Princess Louisa Inlet.  Words cannot describe the beauty.  Google and check.
Smuggler's Cove.  Vancouver Sunday.
